channel.title: Mass Replace - Java Program By Davidi2 V1.3 RELEASED

item.title: Mass Replace - Java Program By Davidi2 V1.3 RELEASED
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Not bad, i once thought of creating something like this, but instead of mass replacing it just renamed every single object with a letter and once the alphabet ended it would do aa, ab, ac, etc. Never got to it though. But i was going to use it as a sort of way to ‘Obfuscate’ stuff. Which simply means to make something obscure or unclear, and in this case unreadable.

This would be good for a professional anti leech though but a little bit too intense.

Read full topic

item.title: Mass Replace - Java Program By Davidi2 V1.3 RELEASED
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:41, topic:328415”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=424804.msg3124072#msg3124072 date=1265847245]

Or you can download an IDE which 99% of the time comes with a refactoring option.

And renaming option.

That’s what refactoring is…

Lol.
Elve, refactoring is where it will automatically rename a certain variable in all of your classes. (pretty sure :|)

But even though this a IDE can do the same thing, you could use this to change HTML pages and the like. (for example changing a URL that doesn’t work anymore)
[/quote]

There are IDEs for HTML.[/quote]
Mhm, Dream Weaver etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Mass Replace - Java Program By Davidi2 V1.3 RELEASED
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:35, topic:328415”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=424804.msg3120769#msg3120769 date=1265503724]
What?
[/quote]
I am saying that it will replace all instances of the string therefore if you have a string called a and “a” within the string it will change the name of the string and parts of the string. So basically you change more that you wanted.[/quote]
If you don’t want to rename everything (this program is for replacing everything) then I would suggest using CTRL+H.

Fat Cookies:

i lold hard at class naming. (That is not called obfuscating…)

Yes, what I thought obfuscation was I learned from a guide that was completely wrong… written by an idiot. Apoc kindly told me what it actually meant, at least enough to realize how stupid I looked.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

MistaBigBoss:

open notepad, control + H type the text you want to replace type the text you want it to be click replace all and voila ur done why the hell would u need such a program if its that easy and i stick with the old fashion way no IDE’s for meh

Wait for v3 tonight kay?

It will have regex replacement, GUI, file overwrite, backup protection, case sensitivity, selection of files from more then one folder etc.

@AMERIKA - If I don’t post it tonight (and no one prevents me from doing so) then I will leave these forums and never come back.

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:22, topic:328415”]I declare pointlessnesses.

wut happens when you have this…

public static String hello = "hello ";
public static String world = "world";
System.out.println("I think, "+hello+world);

I just want to rename teh hello string to firstWord and the world string to secondWord.
I know I use mass replace and my program changes from:
I think, hello world

to:
I think, firstWord secondWord[/quote]
What?

AMERIKA:

why did you obfuscate this. you must be retarded.

I did it to test the program, as I stated many times.
I deob’d class1 in v3. (coming tonight)

Read full topic
